data.title: Our puppy scooby
data.text: It was e great place to bring our puppy and food was awsome we will definitely be back soon and great service

data.title: Nice Bar
data.text: The food and service here have been pretty good, and consistent each time we've visited. Admittedly we go more often for drinks than food and enjoy watching sports there. If they would swap out the imitation red bull for the name brand or even a better imitation, I would visit a lot more.

data.title: I am giving it the doubt with a three.
data.text:
We attended the Lees's Summit Octoberfest Fall Festival. There was lots of people and we chose The Peanut rather than eating outside at one of the food booths. At 11:30 we were only the second of two tables seated. The young waitress quickly took our order, but when questioned about the Ruben she said she had never eating a Ruben, but was very popular. So we ordered two Rubens and a side of onion rings. 
It took too long to get our food out of the kitchen considering our's was the only order thet had to prepare at the time. When our Ruben finally came it was tasty, but not the best by far that I have had. It was very sloppy and difficult to eat by hand. However it was a nice portion. The onion rings were a $1 upcharge over the standard chips. They were served in a generous in portion and fried to perfection. 

The waitress delivered our bill to the table and went to another table and sat and chatted with what appeared other staff members. I had to wave the bill in order to get the attention of our waitress.

data.title: Yuck!
data.text: Stopped in for something to eat before the Friday night downtown Lee's Summit Folk music free fest.  Expected decent "bar food", but what was served was really awful, and the place was a real dump.  Dirty, stinky (like sewer gas smell), sticky floors, sticky tables with trash on them.  Crud in the corners and the bathroom was so gross.  Went outside to the deck; but the nice place to hang out was gone.  Overflowing ashtrays, cigars, beer bottles, trash everywhere.  I just wanted to leave so bad, but needed to grab something quick.  Don't go!

data.title: Suffering in Purgatory
data.text:
I have never written a review before, but the feculent experience that I just had compelled me to do so. To give a back story I have worked as a server in both bars and restaurants at multiple establishments over the past 7 years and never seen anything to this extent. I am amazed this place is still in business. 
The evening started with us seating ourselves as the sign instructed. The place wasn't very busy, Thursday evening, 7:20 to be precise. We promptly seated ourselves at the bar and talked for upwards of thirty minutes prior to being acknowledged by the staff whatsoever. Rather than being greeted and made to feel welcome the server rushed us as if our presence was imposing. As soon as we ordered a round of waters she rushed off without allowing another word. We planned to order beers and an appetizer at the same time. Ten minutes later she came back with the four waters and spilled mine all over both the bar and myself. No big deal, Accidents happen. She did promptly get me a replacement. Though she immediately left again as I was initiating our order, cutting me off. After what seemed an eternity I approached a manager and informed her that we were still without anything but water after surplus time and requested that they send us our server. During the fifteen minute hiatus between our server's return we decided to clean up the dirty dishes that plagued our seating area and had been present since our arrival. 
Once our server finally returned we were once again rushed through our order. Keep in mind we are only just now being allowed to order anything past waters after forty five minutes of being there. We ordered our appetizer, nachos, we requested the jalapenos and sour cream come as sides rather than on top as not everyone wanted them. Of course when they came out the sour cream was right on top of the nachos and there weren't even jalapenos present. She grudgingly went off to fix the error after making us feel bad for even fretting over the discrepancy. The new nachos were soggy and cold but we agreed to hold out in hopes of the service turning around. That was the last time we ever saw our server. 
We conferred amongst each other regarding the fact that our beers were still non existent as we sat and ate our nachos. Upon finishing the nachos we waited another ten minutes or so and concluded not only that the beers were never coming but it would be hopeless to attempt to order an entree. After two brutal hours of being baited we called it quits. 
I settled the bill with the manager and we left for the 54th Street bar just down the road; we had great service with a wonderful atmosphere.

data.title: Greasy food, poor service
data.text:
Stopped in for the first - and last - time Friday evening.
Had the fish & chips which was a mistake.  Fish was obviously the cheapest they could get from some wholesaler but they managed to make it even worse by deep frying it until it was hard and greasy.
Tables were dirty and although I noted poor service it was obviously poor management as I only saw 2 servers for a very large room on a busy Friday after work.
Only plus side was a large beer list, which was overpriced.
If you want to go some place loud and dirty to stare at a TV, drink an overpriced beer and eat bad food - then congratulations - you found it!
There are way too many places to enjoy a meal in Lees Summit to waste your time and money here.

data.title: Old nuts
data.text: Terrible. I have been there three times all the same. Whoever runs the place does nothing right! Under staffed! Don't waste your time.

data.title: The Peanut
data.text: Better than your average bar food.    Huge beer list---and cold, too.   Prompt, efficient service.   Plenty of TV's for watching sports.

data.title: Great Service, and Friendly
data.text:
Went with some out of town guest, to show them a good relaxing time. TV's everywhere for game time, and the staff was friends, and food was really good.  One of the only places in town with a Shuffle Board, had a blast with our friends. 
Chili chese fries were great, and so were the Shrooms(Fried mushrooms).  Wings are their signature thing, they are amazing.

data.title: Fun environment, need to upgrade TVs
data.text: Great bar, food is good, they have huge hot wings. Gets crowded late at night and during big games, they have some decent TVs, but their big projection screen does not have a good picture at all. Still a fun place.

data.title: Good place for a casual place to get together
data.text:
Peanut Lee's Summit is in the midst of downtown old Lee's Summit, so you're around a variety of the quaint shops.  It's larger and roomier than the original location on Main Street, so it accomodates the happy-hour crowd without feeling packed.  Their food is average bar-fare, which is to say nothing spectacular, but tasty.  It may be part of the Peanut family, but the food is very different than the original.  

They also have a patio area in the back, which is a fantastic place to hang out with friends.  The servers are attentive, yet casual, which makes it a good place to catch up with your friends without feeling rushed!

It is one of the few areas in downtown Lee's Summit open later in the night, which is great during the summer months when Lee's Summit has their weekly Friday night concerts, right across the street!

data.title: This place is terrible especially in comparison to the other locations...don't go!!!
data.text: We love the other Peanut locations, but this place is a disaster.  I guess we should have known when they told us they were out of bread and had been all afternoon..their signature dishes are blts, and chicken wings.  How hard is it to send someone to the store for bread???  They offered up an alternative bread option but when we got our blts we were convinced they had been pre-made and pulled out of the fridge....cold bread (supposed to be toasted)  and cold bacon...we are not talking room temperature, we are talking hurt your teeth cold.  When we told the waitress she just babbled on about how confusing it all was and had they had a past problem with patrons complaining about the nachos being cold...whatever!  Needless to say, we will fill our Peanut cravings at the original location on Main in KCMO.

data.title: Awesome Wings
data.text: 127 & Metcalf location.  Huge wings are offered here, they must come from some special type of bird that is allowed to grow to a much larger example than the typical roasting hen you normally find at the store.  I typically order them well done to get even more of the crunchy goodness and take away any lingering gaminess.  Loaded with sauce that is just the right level of spice and zippiness.  The "green" blue cheese dressing is awesome but will linger with you the next day.

data.title: Best BLTs in Kansas City
data.text: I use to eat at the peanut all the time for lunch with my aunt. It's a great place for lunch or dinner, they have a big menu with a wide variety. They have great appetizers and sandwiches. They have the best BLT I've ever had, they put shredded cheese and onions on theirs. We had the fried pickles for an appetizer when we were there last, and they were the big spear kind, and so delicious. I think the only downfall is the BLT and sandwiches come with potato chips which I don't eat, and they charge you to substitute french fries. They do have cheese fries as an appetizer that are really awesome, they have a cheese sauce and shredded cheese on them. It's a great place for lunch or dinner, and a great place to sit and listen to music.

data.title: Beer, beer and more beer! Yum!!!
data.text: Beer, beer and more beer! Yum!!!

data.title: Great wings and cheap beer.  It has a couple of the best bartenders working the bar.
data.text: Great wings and cheap beer.  It has a couple of the best bartenders working the bar.
